>
[Dandy Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=6302) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=572" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 195 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Dandy](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=246)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39)

</column>

---

You are a consummate student of dignity, etiquette, and fashion. You become trained in [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) and [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47); if you were already trained in either, you become an expert in it instead. You gain the Influence Rumor downtime activity. 

<document level="2" id="action-2980" />

<title level="2">Dandy Dedication leads to...</title>
[Costume Change](/Feats.aspx?ID=7640), [Distracting Flattery](/Feats.aspx?ID=6303), [Fabricated Connections](/Feats.aspx?ID=6305), [Fit for the Role](/Feats.aspx?ID=7641), [Gossip Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=6304), [More Real than Real](/Feats.aspx?ID=7646), [Operatic Adventurer](/Feats.aspx?ID=7635), [Party Crasher](/Feats.aspx?ID=6306), [Perfect Pitch](/Feats.aspx?ID=7636), [Play to the Crowd](/Feats.aspx?ID=7637)
